result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad B Unferth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision. Breakdown as follows: $184,186.87 to victim D.C.; $2,743.53 to American Family Ins; $5,537.56 to victim D.C. from case 14CF859; $955.00 to St. Jerome's Catholic Church from case 13CM1529; $200.00 to victim M.H. from case 14CF686; $567.59 for Guaranty Bank from case $15CF486.  Attorney Masnica to notify the Court within 90 days of any specific amount contested for a restitution hearing.
PER RESTITUTION HEARING 3/30/2016:  PARTIES STIPULATED TO:
13CM1529:  $955.00 to be paid to St. Jeromes Church
14CM686:  $200.00 to be paid to Maureen House
15CF486:  $567.59 to be paid to Guaranty Bank
15CF706:  $2,743.53 to be paid to American Family
15CF706:  $90,000.00 to be paid to Deborah Collins

Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

No Contact with T.K., M.H., D.C., S.T., or C.B. or any of their residences. No Contact with St. Jerome's Church.  Follow through with any AODA treatment, counseling. No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
Maintain full-time employment and/or school combination. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Court's Response to Defendant's Motion to Amend Judgment of Conviction

Cover letter regarding motion to amend judgment filed by defendant.    **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 11/19/19:  Motion denied without a hearing or further consideration as the sentencing court has already addressed eligibility for programs. Defendant, in effect, seeks a modification of his sentence without adequate support in law or fact. Therefore the motion is denied.**

Defendant Chad B Unferth in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recommendations by the State.  Statements by M.H. and D.C.  Arguments by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 10 years (Initial Confinement: 5 years, Extended Supervision: 5 years) 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- Court costs waived
- Restitution in the amount of $194,190.55 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision as follows:  $184,186.87 to D.C.; $2,743.53 American Family Ins.; $5,537.56 to D.C. (from 14CF859); $955.00 to St. Jerome's Catholic Church (from 13CM1529); $200.00 to M.H. (for 14CF686); $567.59 to Guaranty Bank (for 15CF486).  Attorney Masnica to notify the Court within 90 days of any specific amount contested for a restitution hearing.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  No contact with T.K., M.H., D.C., S.T., or C.B. or any of their residences.  No contact with St. Jerome's Church.  Pay restitution in 15CF706.  Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Court orders bail revoked pending sentencing.
